info.description: Partner API for Contio MeetingOS - External partner integration endpoints
info.title: Contio MeetingOS Partner API

get.description: Returns the JSON Web Key Set for token verification
Returns the OpenID Connect discovery document

post.description: Initiates passwordless authentication for partner OAuth flow with client-specific SECRET_HASH
Verifies OTP code for partner OAuth flow with client-specific SECRET_HASH

get.description: Retrieves all agenda items for a specific meeting. Filters out items restricted to leads if the user is not an editor.
get.summary: Get agenda items for a meeting

get.description: Handles OAuth 2.0 authorization requests for partner applications

post.description: Completes OAuth 2.0 authorization after user consent and returns Cognito authorization code
Checks if user has already consented to the requested scopes and can skip consent page

get.description: Tests connectivity to Cognito and returns service status

post.description: Introspects access tokens to get token information
Revokes an access or refresh token. Per RFC 7009, returns success even for invalid tokens.

parameters.description: Hint about token type (access_token or refresh_token)
parameters.name: token_type_hint

get.description: Returns the list of all available OAuth scopes for partner applications

post.description: Exchanges authorization code for access tokens

get.description: Returns user information for the provided access token

post.description: Creates a new agenda item for a meeting. User must be a participant of the meeting.

403.description: User is not a participant of the meeting

put.description: Updates an existing agenda item. User must be a participant of the meeting.

403.description: User is not a participant of the meeting

delete.description: Deletes an agenda item. User must be a participant of the meeting.

403.description: User is not a participant of the meeting

get.description: Retrieves information about the authenticated partner app

put.description: Updates partner app details like name, description, and webhook URL
Updates the status of the authenticated partner app

get.description: Retrieves user connections for the authenticated partner app with pagination and filtering
Retrieves a specific user connection by ID if it belongs to the authenticated partner app

delete.description: Revokes a user connection by ID if it belongs to the authenticated partner app

get.description: Returns the status, age, and health information for all partner credentials

post.description: Rotates the API key with optional grace period
Rotates the client secret with optional grace period

get.description: Returns the audit history for credential operations

post.description: Rotates the webhook secret with optional grace period

get.description: Retrieves the OIDC IdP configuration for the authenticated partner app

put.description: Updates the OIDC IdP configuration for the authenticated partner app. Note: idp_client_id and idp_client_secret are the OIDC credentials from your Identity Provider (e.g., Okta, Azure AD), NOT your Contio Partner OAuth credentials.

post.description: Creates a new OIDC IdP configuration for the authenticated partner app. Note: idp_client_id and idp_client_secret are the OIDC credentials from your Identity Provider (e.g., Okta, Azure AD), NOT your Contio Partner OAuth credentials.

delete.description: Deletes the OIDC IdP configuration for the authenticated partner app

get.description: Retrieves webhook deliveries for the authenticated partner app
Retrieves a specific webhook delivery by ID
Retrieves all workflows for the authenticated partner app

post.description: Creates a new workflow for action item matching

400.description: Invalid request body or validation error

get.description: Retrieves a specific workflow by ID for the authenticated partner app

put.description: Updates a specific workflow for the authenticated partner app

400.description: Invalid request body or validation error

get.description: Returns safe public partner app information for display in OAuth login/consent pages. This endpoint does not require client authentication and only returns safe public information like name and company.
get.summary: Get Public Partner Information by Client ID

get.description: Handles the OIDC callback from the partner's identity provider. Exchanges the authorization code for tokens, validates the ID token, and provisions or authenticates the user.

302.description: Redirect to application after successful authentication

get.description: Returns partner branding and SSO configuration status for landing pages. This endpoint is publicly accessible and rate-limited.
Starts the SSO authentication flow for a partner's identity provider. Looks up the partner by slug, retrieves IdP configuration, generates PKCE parameters, and returns an authorization URL.

parameters.description: Target platform: web (default), desktop, backlog, or meeting:{id}
parameters.name: target

404.description: Partner not found or IdP not configured

get.description: Returns the current status of a partner SSO session for polling. Used by clients to check if authentication has completed.
Retrieves action items accessible to the authenticated partner user

post.description: Creates a new action item on behalf of the authenticated user

get.description: Retrieves a specific action item by ID if accessible to the authenticated partner user

put.description: Updates an existing action item if accessible to the authenticated user

delete.description: Deletes an action item if accessible to the authenticated user

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of calendar events for the authenticated user within a specified time range

parameters.description: Number of results per page (default 25, max 100)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Sort direction: asc or desc (default: asc)
parameters.name: direction

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific calendar event for the authenticated user

403.description: User does not have access to this calendar event

post.description: Creates a new meeting by copying details from a calendar event

200.description: Meeting already exists for this calendar event

get.description: Retrieves meetings accessible to the authenticated partner user

post.description: Creates a new meeting on behalf of the authenticated partner user

get.description: Retrieves a specific meeting by ID if accessible to the authenticated partner user. When the autopilot_smart_redirect feature flag is enabled and the meeting has been copied to the user's workspace, the response will contain only the redirect_to_meeting_id field pointing to the workspace copy. Clients should follow this redirect to access the correct meeting. The Partner SDK handles this automatically.

200.description: Meeting details or smart redirect hint (redirect_to_meeting_id field only when redirecting)

patch.description: Updates an existing meeting if accessible to the authenticated partner user

post.description: Link an existing calendar event to a specific meeting

200.description: Meeting linked to calendar event successfully

400.description: Invalid meeting ID format or request body

404.description: Meeting or calendar event not found

409.description: Calendar event already linked to another meeting

delete.description: Remove the link between a calendar event and a specific meeting

200.description: Meeting unlinked from calendar event successfully

get.description: Retrieves all participants for a specific meeting accessible to the authenticated partner user
Retrieves the authenticated user's profile information

allowed_email_domains.description: Email domains allowed for SSO (required for strict mode). Users with other domains will be rejected.

claim_mappings.description: Maps Contio user fields to IdP claim names. Defaults to {"email": "email", "name": "name"}. Only change if your IdP uses non-standard claim names.

discovery_url.description: OIDC discovery endpoint URL from your Identity Provider (must end with /.well-known/openid-configuration)

idp_client_id.description: OAuth Client ID from your Identity Provider's OIDC application. This is NOT your Contio Partner client_id.

idp_client_secret.description: OAuth Client Secret from your Identity Provider's OIDC application. This is NOT your Contio Partner client_secret. Stored encrypted at rest.

mode.description: Domain validation mode: "strict" requires allowed_email_domains, "partner_managed" trusts your IdP's user base

name.description: Display name for this IdP configuration

scopes.description: OIDC scopes to request during authentication. Defaults to ["openid", "email", "profile"]

claim_mappings.description: Maps Contio user fields to IdP claim names

discovery_last_fetched_at.description: When the OIDC discovery document was last fetched

idp_client_id.description: OAuth Client ID from your Identity Provider (secret is never returned)

is_active.description: Whether this IdP configuration is active

name.description: Display name for this IdP configuration

allowed_email_domains.description: Email domains allowed for SSO (required for strict mode)

claim_mappings.description: Maps Contio user fields to IdP claim names

discovery_url.description: OIDC discovery endpoint URL from your Identity Provider

idp_client_id.description: OAuth Client ID from your Identity Provider's OIDC application. This is NOT your Contio Partner client_id.

idp_client_secret.description: OAuth Client Secret from your Identity Provider's OIDC application. This is NOT your Contio Partner client_secret. Stored encrypted at rest.

is_active.description: Enable or disable this IdP configuration

name.description: Display name for this IdP configuration

scopes.description: OIDC scopes to request during authentication

errors.ErrorResponse.description: Standard error response format used across all API endpoints All error responses follow this consistent structure for predictable error handling

message.description:
Human-readable error message
@Description User-friendly description of what went wrong
message.example: The requested resource could not be found

request_id.description:
RequestID is the unique request identifier for tracing
@Description Request identifier to correlate errors with logs

errors.PartnerErrorResponse.description: Standard error response format used across all partner API endpoints This format is used by both partner admin and partner user APIs for consistency

code.description:
Error code identifying the specific type of error
@Description Unique identifier for the error type, useful for programmatic error handling

error.description:
Human-readable error message
@Description User-friendly description of what went wrong

request_id.description:
RequestID is the unique request identifier for tracing
@Description Request identifier to correlate errors with logs

user_provisioned.description: Indicates if user was newly created

d.description: For RSA and ECDSA private keys (optional)

description.example: Call or schedule meeting to discuss

message.example: Meeting created successfully from calendar event
Meeting linked to calendar event successfully

description.example: Follow up with client about proposal
